verb.description: To weigh (a matter, subject, etc.) in the mind; to ponder, consider, contemplate. Also occasionally without object. Now rare.

origin: 1920s; earliest use found in The Times. From classical Latin ponderātus, past participle of ponderāre<br>late 15th century; earliest use found in Higden's Polychronicon. From classical Latin ponderāt-, past participial stem of ponderāre ponder.
